intro: Spermacoce bolivarensis, commonly known as the Bolivian moonseed, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its small, white, star-shaped flowers. The plant produces small, spherical berries that contain several seeds, typical of the genus Spermacoce. It is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and undergrowth. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists.
